22710993.review:
Yes. Yes. And a million times: YES!

Delivered by the developers of the probably most controversial game "Hatred" comes their newest work: IS Defense.
So what is it about? In case you haven't noticed already, the game is set in a unreal (yet scaringly possible) future where ISIS has taken over north Africa and is starting an offensive against Europe. Your job is to stop them, one Bullet at a time...

(TL;DR in the end)

First things first, I don't like rail shooters. I don't like them at all. But this game does not feel like a rail shooter, more like a first-person tower defense, and it's totally AWESOME!

[u]PLOT:[/u]
Your only task in the game is to pop some Jihadists. How? It's up to you.
Unlike other railshooters (even though I won't count IS Defense as one) you don't just click with your cursor across the screen, instead you're placed on a stationary fortificated hill with a Machine gun (unlimited ammo, but magazine size of 200 shots) and a Bazooka (you start with 6 shots, you get more via supply drops, I'll get to them later), which can turn around 360 degrees.

Along with your weapons, you are given a variety of point streaks (Supply drop, Infantry support, Artillery support, Air support and Helicopter support). They are all feeding from the same score pool, that means if you call in a support, you will maybe not be able to call in a different one.

While you're mowing down the islamist invaders, you gain XP, which gives your character level ups. At each level up you get one point, which can be spent in your skill tree (4 branches: Player, Machine gun, Rockets, support), which works like most other skill trees (get the lower skills to unlock higher ones, the higher ones cost more points).

[u]MAPS:[/u]
The game is really hard in the beginning, but the more games you play, the stronger your character gets, the easier the game gets. Then you unlock the next map, which is harder and requires you to rank up higher to beat it etc.
I've only played the first 2 maps yet and I have to say that the developers did great work with them. I was expecting the maps to be the same with just a different look, but they aren't. While the first map is an open beach, the second map is a harbor. Where the first map was feeling hard first because of the wide field the enemies were approaching from, you will miss this wide open field in the second map. The enemies rush out of several buildings, stand on the roofs and rush around the corner with their armored cars (yes, they don't just have Toyotas with Machine guns).

[u]ENEMIES:[/u]
The enemies vary from regular infantry, infantry with rocket launchers, suicide bombers, Toyotas and armored cars (at least I have seen so far)
Watch out for the suicide bombers tho. They're easy to spot (red clothing, suicide belt and running directly at you without a gun continously shouting in Arabic) as long as all is chilled, but when the whole screen is full of enemies, you suddenly see a Kebab infront of your face and the game is over. Regular infantry will also throw grenades when they come close to you and run away when they're on fire. The enemy vehicles try to (and WILL) run over your infantry, watch out for them. When you shoot the driver of a Toyota while the car is in motion, the car will go loose, may run over people, crash into a building, drive into the ocean and die or just turn in circles until it explodes from the fire.
All in all, the AI is perfect.

[u]POINT STREAKS:[/u]

Supply drops: A dropship will drop a crate with either health or rockets into the combat zone. Shoot the crate to get it. Upgrades increase the crate number or the contents itself (like 100% health regen).
My suggestion: stockpile your crates so you can shoot the health boxes when you need them instead of calling a drop when you're low at health and die.

Infantry support: My favourite one so far. This steak calls in a group of friendly soldiers (marked with a blue diamond) to fight the enemies. Not only do they help you get more kills, they also distract the enimes from you, giving you more time to fight more enemies, reload, etc.
My suggestion: Use as much as possible.

Artillery support: Covers the combat zone with Artillery. Impacts are random and they might (and WILL) hit your allies too. Also the standard one is really short.
My suggestion: Upgrade to the longer lasting artillery and when you use it, call in the infantry after the shelling is over.

Air support: Call in jets that nuke (not really) the combat zone. More effective but more expensive than artillery.
My suggestion: Use it when you can affort it.

Helicopter support: Calls in an attack helicopter that attacks anything hostile on the combat zone. Destroys Toyotas in the blink of a second and really takes some weight off your shoulders.
My suggestion: Use it when there's heavy enemy activity.

[u]GRAPHICS/AMBIENT[/u]
The graphics are great, as you would expect it from a 2016 game. The game is running great on High-Ultra settings for me, only having massive lags sometimes when shit hits the fan but it only lasts a short moment and continues fluently afterwards.
The explosions are realistic, shells are flying across the screen, blood, gore and corpses everywhere (you can set the body count in the options, I suggest "unlimited" for the ultimae Kebab removal experience. The vehicles behave very realistic (like stated in the "enemies" section). The game is really packing and you wil feel the adrenaline rush through your body while you're defending Europe from the terrorist invaders.

[u]MODS[/u]
I tested no mods so far because the mod support just came in, but I expect some great stuff from you guys.


TL;DR
This is the ultimate fast-paced first-person kebab remover game in the world. Get it. GET IT NOW!

22701014.review:
IS Defense,

As the name says, puts you in a defensive position behind a fictional LMG. The objective of the game is as simple as it can be entertaining. Hold your ground as long as possible.
This game is very similar to P.O.W., Operation Wolf, Vietnam Gunner, Beach Head etc.
The genre is as old as computer gaming and it hasn't lost its glory. That is, if you like those kind of games.

So what is there actually to do?
1) Take out as many targets as possible before dying.
2) By destroying targets you gain round based and persistent experience points.
3) Persistent Experience points can be used to acquire permanent upgrades.
4) Round based experience points are used to call in power ups, or allied aid through soldiers, planes, arty and helicopters.

The presentation is more than adequate.
The Sound effects and narration are good.

Final verdict:
If you're offended by the name of this game then you shouldn't be on Steam, which is a western product, in the first place.
Besides of that, IS Defense is a stationary turret defense action packed ride that delivers for its low price.

Die Gegner sind in diesem Fall IS Terroristen, doch anstatt derer kann man jeden x-beliebigen Gegnertypen nehmen, ob nun eine unbekannte Organisation, Aliens oder Rinderhälften, das Prinzip bleibt dasselbe. Je mehr Gegner man abschießt, desto besseren Support bekommt man, angefangen bei einem Frachtflugzeug, welches einem eine (später zwei) Kisten mit jeweils Munition oder Leben abwirft, bis hin zum Helikopter, der Feuerunterstützung aus der Luft gibt. Dazu kann man diese Unterstützung und sein eigenes Geschütz mit durch Abschüsse erzielte Skill Points verbessern, zum Beispiel, dass man nie wieder nachladen muss, oder dass die Geschosse (und wahlweise auch Raketen) schneller fliegen. Oder man möchte, dass der Helikopter nicht mit MGs sondern auch mit Raketen schießt? Kein Probem, auch dafür gibt es einen Skill! 
Das ganze wurde mit der Unreal 4 Engine aufgebaut, und ich muss sagen, dass das Spiel, und besonders die Explosionen sehr schön aussehen. Dazu muss ich sagen, dass dies das erste Spiel mit der Unreal 4 Engine ist, welches meinen Grafikkarten-Treiber für meine AMD Radeon R9 380 NICHT zum Absturz bringt.
Ich habe jetzt 2 Stunden gespielt und bin dabei, die Dritte (und bisher auch letzte?) Mission abzuschließen, und es kommt noch keine Langeweile auf. Ich hoffe, dass noch mehr Content folgt, mich würde es freuen.

Dazu hier ein kleines Gameplay für bewegte Bilder!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zvYGx9GaGl0

22625700.review:
IS Defense je vedlejším projektem z dílny autorů Hatred - polského studia Destructive Creations. Prezentace před vydáním neslibovaly žádný převratný titul - jen bezduchý rail shooter na aktuálním pozadí konfliktu s Islámským státem.

Jelikož se představitelé světových mocností k radikální intervenci v ISIS kontrolované oblasti příliš nemají, máme možnost islámským teroristům nakopat zadky alespoň ve hře, a s tímto zaujetím jsem nadšeně hru nainstaloval po jejím zakoupení v předobjednávce za přímo ďábelskou cenu 6.66 Euro. A ačkoliv hra nenabízí nic světoborného, nebyl jsem zklamán a svých prozatímních 6 hodin hry jsem si dokonale užil.

Ve hře zasednete za hlaveň kulometného hnízda a bráníte před invazí pobřeží Evropy ve třech tématicky odlišných prostředích se stupňující se obtížností - pláž, přístav a poušť. Vaše věž je volně pohyblivá a kontrolujete tak 360º perimetr. Kromě kulometu máte k dispozici omezený počet raket a úspěšná likvidace invazních sil vám umožňuje vyžádání podpory - munice a zdraví, pěchotní výsadek, podporu dělostřelectva, letectva či bitevního vrtulníku.

Vaším úkolem je jednoduše přežít co nejdéle. Počty nepřátel i pro ISIS typických vozidel postupně rostou, takže dříve nebo později se vám některý z islamistů odpálí přímo pod nosem. Takže aby vaše střelba byla efektivnější, nezbývá než si postupně vylepšovat vlastnosti vaší střílny pomocí zkušenostních bodů, jež získáváte za úspěšnou likvidaci protivníků. Nic víc než zběsilá survival akce vás ve hře nečeká. Level ukončíte zničením požadovaného počtu nepřátel a vozidel a dohrání hry je otázkou několika hodin dle vašich schopností.

Co mě u hry drželo, je dokonalá atmosféra a zpracování. Slušná grafika s barevným laděním podobným jako u Hatred, četné a bohaté exploze, efektní zpomalení obrazu při podařeném zásahu i dynamická hudba mě přikovaly k monitoru. Postupné vylepšování zbraně a efektivnější likvidace invazních sil mě motivovala ve snaze přežít co nejdéle. A jakmile se mi podařilo získat upgrade, ve kterém vymizela nutnost nabíjení kulometu, kontinuální déšť kulek a screen zaplněný explozemi i kouřem mi přinášel dokonalou satisfakci z akce.

I po dohrání se určitě k IS Defense vrátím. Zbývá mi ještě sesbírat všechny upgrady, což ještě pěknou nálož mrtvých islamistů bude vyžadovat. Od hry neočekávejte propracované mise, taktiku či měnící se herní náplň. Opravdu není na dlouhodobé herní seance. Ale na občasné odreagování a “vyblbnutí” je IS Defense skvělý.

A jestli máte obavy z kontroverze, kterou údajně má hra přinášet, vaše obavy jsou zhola zbytečné. Nadměrné brutality jako u Hatred se nedočkáte. A pokud máte problém, že likvidujete islámské teroristy, místo nich si představte jiné panáčky v podobě Němců, Rusů, Vietkongu nebo třeba mutantů z Doomu.

Jako bonus nám autoiři ještě přidali čtvrtou herní lokaci - vyhřáté Saint Tropez, takže o dalších pár hodin máme herní dobu prodlouženou. A navíc zcela zdarma, za což polští designéři zaslouží pochvalu.

22611693.review:
不謹慎とかとかそういう話は置いといて、ゲームとしてのレビュー。


■概略
中央と北アフリカを制覇し、ヨーロッパに上陸してくるISISの軍勢を迎え撃つ、という設定のレールシューター。
プレイヤーはヨーロッパ各地の防衛線の最前線に立ち、機銃座でテロリスト達を迎撃する。
現状ステージは三つで、どれも死ぬまで戦うエンドレスモード。
何度もプレイして一定数の敵を倒すと次のステージがアンロックされる仕組み。

時間がたつにつれてテロリストの攻勢が激しくなり、最終的には装甲車が次々と突進してくる。
機銃だけでは火力不足なので、敵を倒したポイントを使って歩兵部隊や砲爆撃の支援を受けないとすぐ死ぬ。
また経験値をためることでスキルアップし、機銃の威力や支援能力などを強化できる。

■感想
不謹慎とかそういう話は置いといて、レールシューターとしては面白かった。
ステージが少ないのが難点。もっともどのステージも敵の攻撃が激しくすぐ死ぬが。
本当に延々と敵を倒すだけなので、ストーリー性を求める人には向かない。


それにしてもプレイヤーの戦う状況、
死守命令を下されて機銃座にしばりつけられ、死ぬまで戦い続ける独ソ戦の兵士みたいだあ……

Game Details:
„IS Defense” is a game set in politically-fictional 2020 – where the expansion of ISIS went out of hand. They took over all of Northern Africa, spreading their genocidal understanding of the world’s order. Strongly armed, vast in numbers and prepared for everything, the Islamic State is launching the invasion upon Europe, over the entire Mediterranean Sea.

The player takes the role of NATO’s stationary machine-gun operator, deployed to defend the shores of Europe. His task is to blast as many of the invaders as possible, until his glorious death. To do so, he has NATO support forces, his Machinegun and Rocket Launcher at his disposal. During the progress of this heroic defense, he gets the opportunities to upgrade his gear, his body and army rank – which affects the efficiency of the called support.

This game is our small side-project and is our personal veto against what is happening in the Middle East nowadays. As well as an attempt at resurrecting a pretty dead genre of games like „Operation Wolf” or „Beach Head” – in a state of the art, modern adaptation.

Recommended?

22594551.review: 虚幻4打造的抢滩登陆，技能系统不是很完善，似乎没什么作用。但是游戏的场景特效和气氛可以说是全方位定点射击游戏的顶级了，毕竟虚幻4。目前这种类型的游戏并不多，可以说是屈指可数，但是我认为此作品也许会重新煽动起全方位定点射击游戏的热潮，我希望如此，本作品也可以是是小众小投资的作品，在价格上也是比较可以接受的。游戏的缺点目前来说最重要的就是难度没有变量，基本上打到10分钟以后和坚持3小时或者10小时的难度都是一样的，导致我一张图打了3小时左右，最后还是自杀了。希望开发商能增加难度变量，难度随着时间的长短而变化，这个变化可以考虑无限大，当然这确实有点困难制作起来，但是我希望能达到差不多的目标。敌人单位数量比较少，除了自爆兵和步兵，就是悍马和皮卡车了，我也希望能加入一些空中单位，技能也希望能有很多新技能，就目前来说技能全满以后没什么挑战了。还有创意工坊，多人合作，这都是我希望能在以后的更新中看到这些，因为这也是我目前最喜欢的游戏了，虽然成本并不高，但是如此小的成本也能制作出非常不错的作品。最后，有些人觉得这游戏很无聊，我只想告诉你，你永远不知道一个分数能证明出什么，因为你只会放弃，不会努力提升自己的极限，这就是为什么我喜欢这款游戏了！最后感谢开发商能带来如此好玩的游戏，你们的另一款作品《仇恨》也是我最喜欢的。

IS Defense is essentially perfect. An old-school pure arcade shooter, it feels like it should have the big plastic machine-gun hanging off the front. Wonderful adrenalin-fuelled action, and just enough strategy to stop the game being repetitive. There's no story, no plot (beyond 'kill bad guys'), no extensive dialogue trees, just fluid, heart-thudding violence.

Marvellous stuff - a genuine breath of fresh air,  When so many games are vast boredom simulators, this is the quintessence of video games, distilled to utter purity. 

Thank you.

22589710.review:
So, I have a hard time thinking if I should recommend this game or not, mostly due to the prize to gameplay values. Let me explain, on one side I consider a game good if it took me to complete it about 1 hour for every € I spent, and I finished this game and got all skills in about 4 hours  (and I am a mediocre shooter player at best), while the prize is about 7€...that being said, like all Destructive Creations games, it was a Cathartic experience that I will gladly come back to blow some Steam from time to time.

Comparissons to HATRED don't stop there, like in HATRED the controversy and "edgy" theme is actually more challenging than the gameplay, which is pretty safe, from gameplay standpoint the game is solid, if unoriginal. It is pretty difficult and the guys at Destructive Creations are very talented, which kinda doubles the frustration because I really want to see them experimenting and innovating gameplay. Oh and a Coop mode would have made wonders for this.

To close the review I have to say that I would have loved a couple more maps, maybe on Lesbos or other points in the Balkans other than Croatia, fortunately the game is very moddeable so we may see a lot more content from the users if it picks up enough Steam. 

Now it may have been just me, but while I liked the textures and models for the Daesh soldiers, the ones for the NATO troops seem kinda low res...it bugs me a little in between all the explosions and allahu akbars...

22579736.review:
中東から北アフリカまでを占領して、ヨーロッパに押し寄せてくるISISから拠点を防衛するという内容はキャッチーですが、中近東辺りのテロリストと戦う作品が無数にある昨今の現状を鑑みると、実在のテロ組織を敵として扱っている部分を除けば他のゲームのテロリストとの違いは感じられず、特別にISISらしい何か（そんなものがあるのかは不明ですが）があるわけではありませんでした。

内容はFPSやTPSで見かける定点防衛ミッションのみを扱った作品で、プレイヤーは機関銃とロケットランチャーが装備された銃座から押し寄せてくるテロリストを死ぬまで倒し続け、そのスコア（倒した数や生き延びた時間）の更新を目指すだけの作品となっています。
敵を倒すと支援要請のためのゲージが溜まっていき、物資支援、歩兵支援、砲撃支援、空爆支援、ヘリコプター支援をゲージを消費することで要請出来ます。
最大で５までゲージを貯めることが可能で、１ゲージ消費で物資、２ゲージ消費で歩兵・・・となるのですが、正直言って空爆やヘリはコストに見合わなかったので、もう少し支援要素は練ってほしかったです。

他にも敵を倒すことで経験値を入手でき、一定量貯まるとレベルアップ（？）をしてスキルポイントが貰えるようになっています。
スキルポイントを消費することで、永続的に能力アップが可能で、プレイヤー自身の強化（HP関連）、機関銃の強化、ロケットランチャーの強化、支援の強化が可能となっています。
能力アップによる強化は弾速アップのような地味なものもありますが、連射速度２倍だの、同時発射数が増えたり、着弾時に小爆発を起こすようになったりと、スコアを伸ばす上で能力アップは必須となっています。
また、能力アップ具合が物凄いので、変化を如実に感じられ、つい１５分ほど前までは苦戦していたような量の敵相手も楽々撃退できるようになるので、レベルアップによる強化が如実に感じられるのが良かったです。

一箇所から動くこともなく、敵のバリエーションも少なく、マップも３種類しかないので変化に乏しいゲームですが、支援要素や照準などのプレイヤースキルにしろ、レベルアップによる能力強化にしろ、プレイヤーの変化が早いペースで起こるため、２～３時間なら飽きずに黙々とプレイ出来るゲームでした。
ただ、ストーリーも無いし、ゲーム内容の変化もほとんど無いので、ある程度プレイヤーキャラの強化が済んでしまうと飽きてしまうので、価格相応には楽しめる作品でしたが、価格以上には楽しめませんでした。
しかし気軽に購入できる価格なので、まるで戦争映画のクライマックスシーンのようなド派手な戦闘が連続するお手軽なシューティングゲームをプレイしたいというなら楽しめると思います。

22566374.review:
[i] We are The Future – This Endless War
We are The Future – We chose to ignore
We are The Future – We’d been Living for
We are The Future – This Holy War

I’ve not forgiven or forgotten
The fallen or downtrodden
And, I’ll never forget
My Last Europa Kiss[/i]

Наверное, именно эти строки из песни Death In June звучат в голове нашего героя[strike]Андерса Брейвика[/strike], стоически обороняющего подступы к Матушке Европе от нашествия исламской чумы, врывающейся на лодках, транспортерах и бронированных автомобилях с черными флагами, дабы нести смерть и разрушения. В IS Defense Вы, без преувеличения, можете почувствовать себя современным крестоносцем с тяжелым пуеметом, вставшим грудью на защиту фатерлянда и с упоением посылающим свинцовые ливни и огненные ураганы на головы врагов-иноверцев.

Динамичный тир с красивыми эффектами и злободневным сюжетом, оптимизация со времен Hatred'а (хотя на релизе нареканий не было, кадры падали с обновлениями и, следует заметить, бысто фиксились новыми патчами) - значительно лучше.
Не исключено, что ребята из Destructive Creations, захотели выехать именно на популизме, но опять же, как и в случае с Hatred, надо отдать им должное за смачный плевок в сторону политкорректности, столь стремительно навязываемой игровой индустрии. К покупке - обязательно, хотя бы ради того, чтобы поддержать смелого разработчика.

10 Утойя / 10

22541952.review:
http://store.steampowered.com/app/448370/

From Destructive Creations, creators of Hatred, comes IS Defense. An on-rails wave survival  turret shooter.

---- Plot ----

In a politically-fictional setting, the year is 2020, ISIS controls all of the Middle East and the North African region through their conquest of world domination. They're next major step? The invasion of Europe. 

You are put into the boots of a NATO stationary machine-gun operator whose task is to stop the assault by any means given. 

---- Weapons and Skills ----

You're only given two weapons here, a M240 Bravo (at least I think it is) and a rocket launcher. At first starting out, your weapons are fairly weak. Over time, when you start leveling and gaining skill points, your two weapons can take out ememies and vehicles with ease with the upgrades you can earn. 

With skills points you can make your MG shoot faster and deal damage harder, etc. Give your rockets the option to shoot incendiary rockets, bigger blast radius, reload faster, etc. Better support help like "Special Forces" which gives your infantry more health, make your chopper fire rockets. There are quite a bit of skills to put to use here. 

---- Enemies ----

ISIS, duh, but in three varieties. Basic rifleman that will shoot at you. Suiciders that will rush your pillbox in an attempt to kill you. Technicals and stolen Hummvees with LMGs on them that deal little damage if you tackle one. In pairs or more, they'll shred your health if you not careful. 

---- Support ----

Supply Drops - refills your health or rockets

Infantry - helps handle ground targets

Artillery Shelling - handles ground and vehicle targets

Airstrikes (my favorite) - drops bomb payloads onto ground targets and vehicle targets like artillery, but more damage

and lastly, Chopper - does everything the others can do. 

Each one can be upgraded in some way with skill points earned.

---- Overall ----

This game reminds me of Boom Beach, and other rail shooters. Great game to spend time playing to see how far you can last against wave upon wave of fighters. If you unlock all the skills and plan accordingly, you'll be almost unkillable. This game was a side project for the devs and lasts maybe 2-3 hours ..ish and for $8. All in all, I had fun and some memories of the old rail shooters I've played.

22537593.review:
[H1]Destructive Creations, no strangers to courting controversy, serve up another slice of interesting gaming that's almost certainly going to get Polygon foaming at the mouth. Funny thing is, there's a good game here too, and it's cheap![/H1]

So, IS Defence. Islamic State. Dieties bless you Destructive Creations. First you riff Postal with "Hatred" which was a decent enough attempt at Postal, it wasn't -great-, but it was good enough, and despite all the controversy, it was a good enough "shoot everyone" game much in the same vein as Postal. It was a bit clunky, it was definitely cheesy, and much like Postal, it is almost certainly going to be one of those interest pieces that lots of more progressive media pieces chew over and fill their virtual birdcages with down the line on slow news days.

As if that wasn't enough, now you're going to riff Beach Head, another classic game, except this time for the controversy angle you're throwing Islamic State into the mix. I mean, fair play to you, you're based in Poland, so the chances of someone running at you with a suicide vest isn't exactly high, but this is a bit like throwing a red rag to the bull here. The people you're aiming this one at aren't exactly renowned for their sense of humour to put it lightly.

That aside, is the game actually good? Well the answer is "mostly very, and for what they're charging, absolutely"

[H1]Strip away the political undercurrrent and what you have is an Unreal 4 version of Beach Head, very well executed and with a very high, almost Arcade difficulty[/H1]

Put this in an arcade cabinet with some appropriate controls, and this thing would eat your loose change like no tomorrow. Seriously, it's hard, really hard. The first map will take a good dozen attempts before you secure a good foothold and get the hang of what's going on, the second map will throw a whole new set of problems at you (such as your friendly Islamic State militants deciding that a sea only approach is a bit last year, they can now come at you over the road an on the roof of buildings), I'm working on unlocking the third map but there's a good likelihood that'll add even more verticality and yet more difficulty into the mix. This is not by any measure a game where you can autopilot your way to victory. You need to prioritise your targets, get rid of the most dangerous threats, and keep an eye on what's going on at all times, as well as call down your various cooldowns as they become available.

On top of this you have a simple meta levelling tree that offers a nice solid selection of useful upgrades (which in turn make the later levels much more viable), and the ability to fully rotate the turret on it's "rail", which is important for dealing with flanking actions. Graphically at max settings it looks pretty, not jaw dropping, but pretty, with everything represented well enough, and the enemy soldiers flying through the air when the explosions begin the light up the scenery (as well as the beach surf turning red once enough of them die on the first map, that was pleasant!).

Sound effects are passable, not amazing, but passable, in fact a lot of the game can be said to be much the same as Hatred, it's not going to win awards, it's not going to be the high watermark of any particular area, but this is good, solid entertainment, and as a remake of the original Beach Head, without any unnecessary frills or spills, it achieves what it's set out to do, and it does it with a solid level of competency. Most importantly, it's priced at a point which places it firmly in the "impulse buy" area, which means that if you're hesitant, you've really not got too much to lose in giving it a whirl.

[H1]Closing thoughts[/H1]

Destructive Creations are getting a rep for taking old concepts and remaking them very competently, first Postal and now Beach Head, and controversial slants aside, both of these have been executed with decent skill. Neither have been exemplary in either case, but they've been solid entries in the catalog, if these are opening entries in what Destructive Creations can manage, and in time they come up with bigger and better things, then this is a good sign of things to come. As for this one? If you enjoyed Beach Head, well, for the price asked, it's a gimme. If this kind of game isn't your bag, you can safely skip it, it's not going to sell the unconverted.

Verdict : [b]Recommended to fans of the genre, pass if you're not up for shooting a lot of dudes from a fixed turret.[/b]

22536459.review:
It's short, longer than the amount of time I'd like to spend on a date prior to going back to the bedroom though and certainly cheaper than said date which is great.

It's simple, not in a bad way, similar to the kind of girl you meet in a bar who has a few badly done tattoos that are just visible enough to prevent her from getting a job without being sufficient for her to be an alternative model - she's a simple girl but that's what you want in that situation.

It's fun, really fun. Great stress relief. Much like the result of meeting that girl in a bar but with violence as the fun instead of bedroom entertainment. Again, while it's short, it also lasts longer than I do in the bedroom and I don't have to deal with waking up thinking "what the fuck did I do last night" afterwards.


So onto a better review (skip to the bottom if you just want pros and cons). You can forget there being a storyline at all. You're a big ass machine gun with unlimited ammo (though you have to reload until you unlock the chain feed skill) and you have to mow down things attacking you, you also have a rocket launcher attached but this has limited ammo, the machine gun does not. These things attacking are infantymen, trucks and humvees which can attack from 360 degrees and have a range of armour values (the humvees being the most heavily armoured, infantry having no armour and die with a single bullet as far as I can tell). There are 3 maps which can be viewed as easy, medium and hard. The difficulty level is not linear, the second map is a little more challenging than the first, the third map is immensely more challenging than the second.

The enemy design is pretty basic, the humvees look like stolen US military ones, the white trucks look like the beat up toyotas you might find on the sands of the middle East. I do like the touch of them flying IS flags, it's nice to be mowing down hundreds of enemies and feel like you're doing the world some good. There are also small boats and large transporters which carry enemies and can be destroyed prior to landing, though the transporters require 2 or 3 rockets for destruction (but they carry around 6 soldiers and 1 or 2 vehicles)

The graphics are surprisingly nice, solid framerate too, I guess Unreal 3 is to thank for that. The level designs are pretty good, fair. I like the second map the most as it's a good mix between open areas and covered corners that the enemy can attack from. The first map is far too open and gives a lot of chance to destroy enemies before they can attack you as it's a beach and the third map is a little chaotic as enemies seem to come from literally everywhere and have cover until they are relatively close.

There are a series of skills to unlock. You can make the gun more powerful and accurate, you can make your rockets more powerful, you can boost your survivability/health and you can increase your "assistance" power. The assistance is a perk system where within each map you earn experience that can be spent on CPU help in the form of: 
supply drops; health crates and rocket crates, 
infanty support; a group of soldiers who shoot at the enemy with you, 
artillery support; random sustained explosions knocking out enemies around you for a while, 
air support; a group of jets bomb the shit out of the map and 
helicopter support; a chopper hovers around the map shooting shit for you.

The downside is, the difficulty level seems to be tied to the number of skills you have unlocked and to how many forms of assistance you request in each map, or maybe it's simply rated against the XP you're earning in the map. I might be wrong on this but I lasted longest when I had fewest unlocks though. 
I also found that the rocket launcher is a bit of a gimmick, due to the limited ammo and my resistance to wasting experience points on supply crates, I found I didn't use it much as the actual power of the rockets is negligible compared to the fully upgraded gun. 
It would be far improved by the rockets slowly respawning as you play every 30 seconds or so rather than requiring supply crates, or even having that as one of the skill options.

The CPU support also kills the infantry you request when using artillery or airstrikes, to the point some airstikes wipe out all my infantry. Helicopters do not stack, you can only have one at a time. Infantry does stack, but I'm not sure what the limit is. The infantry also tends to run very far out and it's easy to mow them down with enemies once they've expanded away from your area too much. This can be pretty annoying as by 2-3 minutes in each map, CPU support becomes necessary. The helicopter and airstrikes can save your ass, while the infantry often take a lot of the heat off you by eliminating the smaller targets.

You can unlock all the improvements and defeat the map challenges (certain kills and vehicle kills per map) within about 3.5 hours. Considering the game costs as much as about 2 beers here which might last 1 hour at a push with a bunch of friends talking rather than drinking, I'd say that equates to pretty damn good value for money! I'm 4.4 hours in as of writing this and I've killed 16000 enemies - there's an achievement for 30000 which looks like it might be the most difficult achievement in game, along side the last 20 minutes on each map - I think my top survival is about 11 or 12m.

So:
Pros:
+Explosions
+Killing Terrorists
+Stress Relief
+Surprisingly good graphics for the money (thanks, Unreal 3)
+Entertainment
+Value for money (playtime vs cost)

Cons:
-Only 3 maps
-Not much replay value outside of stress relief
-Inability to turn off improvements once unlocked despite increasing difficulty
-Unpredictable and non-linear increase in difficulty level during play
-Fairly short gametime before "completion"

Summary:
Buy it, it's cheap and fun, you wont regret it. There's also a potential for mods in the future (hopefully more maps) so that should extend it some in the end!

22534438.review:
Five problematics out of five.

Deus Vult!

In all seriousness, this is a surprisingly polished game. There isn't a lot to it, structure-wise: you have three levels and four skill trees, and you use a machine gun, rocket launcher, and five different support abilities to destroy waves of attacking soldiers and vehicles. It's very reminiscent of classic arcade games, both in its structure and in its difficulty.

Its simplicity works in its favor, given how the game progresses. You aren't just completing a stage by defeating X waves of enemies and moving on to the next; your objective is to last as long as possible against an increasingly intense assault, with your eventual score ranked according to both your number of kills and the length of time you spent alive. At the beginning of the game, you're going to die early and often, but as you play, you rack up skill points which you can invest into persistent upgrades across attempts.

As you unlock increasingly powerful abilities, you find yourself able to last just a little bit longer each time, and there's a real element of challenge involved in learning how and when to use your support abilities as well as what to prioritize and when. The real challenge of the game is not to finish all three maps (which will happen pretty much no matter what, as "finishing" a map is as simple as racking up a certain number of kills across your playthroughs), but to push yourself to see how long you can last. And you will eventually lose: like the recently released Devil Daggers, "winning" just means getting further than anyone else before you bite it.

My main criticism is a lack of enemy variety: there are normal old soldiers, suicide bombers, technicals, humvees, and three types of landing craft (pontoons, and small and large troop carriers). I'd have liked to see more, different types of soldiers (engineers, grenadiers, machinegunners) or enemy air units. But for the price, and the amount of visual spectacle going on, this is an easy recommendation for a few hours of relaxing rat-a-tat.

22532681.review:
IS Defense is a first person shooting gallery in which the player defends various European areas against an endless supply of fanatical and militant Mohammedans.  

Occurring in the year 2020, it depicts an expanded and aggressive ISIS assuming control of the entire Middle East (including apparently Israel) and North Africa, after which it sets its sights across the Mediterranean Sea.  Not content with mere infiltration of Middle Eastern refugee groups, these undocumented immigrants invade Europe equipped with everything from their conventional armaments (small arms, technicals, skiffs) to military grade weaponry (humvees, armored troop transport ships, etc.).  

The game is very similar to Beach Head 2000 and its sequels, but avoids many of Beach Head's shortcomings by including more contemporary game mechanics such as skill points (which unlock features like faster reload times, explosive ammunition, and increased health), the ability to summon power-ups (supply drops, allied infantry, and apparently airstrikes and mortar bombardments (the last two I haven't yet experienced in the game, though certain parts of the skill tree that I haven't yet unlocked indicate such elements)), and having more than one environment (the game starts the player defending the shores of Sicily, with other settings becoming accessible only after a certain number of enemy troops and vehicles are eliminated; the progress carries over into each new game), so IS Defense, while still easily accessible to the less than hardcore gamers, is also a lot more advanced than the more casual Beach Head games.

An extra touch I particularly enjoy about the game is the roaming camera that sweeps the area after death.  The oncoming hordes are still rushing and chanting their war cries, carcasses litter the scene (there's a feature under the advanced graphics options to have the corpse limit set to "unlimited"), any remaining allied troops still fight to the last man, and I've even seen enemy vehicles fatally run over their own jihadists!  Any supply drops requested just before death are also shown faithfully carrying out their last mission, so I wouldn't be surprised if I see enemy fighters get crushed by the dropped crates someday.

Overall, this is an excellent effort from a gaming studio of modest means, and I hope to see some DLC for it in which the player must defend American shores from the Islamofascists.

You control a MG turret (always stationary, 360 rotation) and shoot waves of ISIS soldiers + their vehicles swarming you. The game has 3 maps.

- Mouse = aiming, shooting
- Keyboard = rotate turret & fire rockets & call air support & tactical reload MG

It's not a huge game, but I played 1.8 hours straight without being bored, and just unlocked the 2nd map. The maps become harder as you go.

After playing (and despising) the buggy mess that was Hatred, I wasn't expecting much out of IS Defense. I was ready to write this off as an extremely stripped-down CoD clone from the get-go.

Then I played it.

Fuckin' A, this game has no right to kick so much ass. Never in my life did I think a rail shooter could be so engaging. I haven't had this much fun with a videogame in a seriously long time. 22525924.review:
It's okay for the cost.  Worth more than a similarly priced fast food combo meal. 

It's a simple yet challenging static defense game, which plays like it belongs in an old school arcade.  No, it's not a rail shooter.  This train ain't going anywhere unfortunately.

Pros:

Kill Islamic State.  'nuff said.

Pretty graphics, lots of fire and explosions.  The smoke, mist, and vegetation obscuring the battlefield give it a realistic feel that makes you question if the daeshbags are coming.  (get UAV skill to end this problem)

Gets challenging and strategic.  You have to deal with flanking attacks, and balance your supply, infantry, artillery, airstrike, and chopper support.  Decisions have to be made very quickly.

The real time leaders board that updates as you play.  Good call.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Cons:

Too short.  There's only three levels.  

AI is stooopid, even considering that they're daeshbags.  Drivers will run over their own infantry, and crash into things.  Vehicles don't move intelligently, they seem to just follow a set path and smash through anything in the way.  Enemy and friendly infantry make no use of cover and concealment or even keeping one's head down.

There's only a few enemy types I've seen so far.  Infantry, suicide bombers, trucks, humvees, and the three different landing boats.  When you play your first game you'll see all of them.  Nothing new to see through game progression except the two other maps.

Debris piles up and clutters the battlefield pretty badly.  This is a good feature sometimes, but annoying when an enemy truck parks behind a pile of blown up vehicles and can't be hit.  Also messes with enemy vehicle pathing.  It looks silly when infantry are standing on top of a wrecked truck engulfed in flames and don't even notice.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Wishlist:

More maps.

More enemy types.  Tanks, rocketeers, car bombs, armored personnel carriers, etc.  Make advanced infantry that throw grenades if they get too close.  

Make it an actual rail shooter.  Do convoy security.  Have to protect the friendly vehicles in the convoy until they get to their destination.  You could string along the missions and incorporate a light storyline instead of making them all a fight to the death.  Ideally this entire game would be just an added survival mode feature while a campaign mode made the bulk of the game.

I hope you incorporate such into sequels/expansions.

22525430.review:
A very fun 'Beach Head' inspired type of game, which actually delivers great chaotic action.
You have 3 maps, each one that has to be unlocked by meeting the requirements of a map in order to move to the next one.
You also have a level up system, which makes your gun stronger and faster, support (like artillery or infantry) more useful, health upgrades and finally rocket launcher upgrades.
The first map starts pretty slow, but this made me underestimate the time i could take to shoot the boats one by one, so i was suprised when they launched a full blown counter attack from my right flank and quickly overrun me. It quickly turned into a big chaotic battlefield.
You can see limbs flying off, IS soldiers crawling their last moments towards you, suicide bombers can be shot to explode their entire squad, machine gunners run out of their vehicles before the vehicle explodes. Great little details which make the game so much better.
Graphics are pretty good considering the amount of craziness going on in the battlefield, i'm suprised my system can hold up (optimization is good).
Replayability is great too, because you have global high scores, achievements and a level up system.

This on-rails, but don't let that deceive you, because this game is worth every cent.

22522948.review:
Because your likely to look for a quick TL;DR when you see a wall of text Imma put it up here where you can see it:

TL;DR - If the Games media outlets are getting triggered about it being 'racist' or 'Islamaphobic' chill and watch the launch trailer and thats as political as it gets, the game is pretty much shooting waves of ISIS soldiers (Black Flag and all) who I think any sane individual will say are horrible. Runs pretty well while looking pretty good and comes with a decent amount of replayabilty even before the built in modding capabilties.



Writing a review before the inevitable shitstorm some of the game media website are bound to stur up.
Its obvious the dev team choose what on the outside looking in would be a 'controversial' topic. Thing is ISIS is a fucking abhorrent terrorist organization and perhaps the most pressing threat to the first world/western civilization making them an obvious antagonistic force not just off their own 'power' or ability but much of the sympathy they seem to be getting from people within the very nations they would sooner see burned to the ground. If media outlets are shilling this game out as racist or islamaphobic just remember that nearly 10 years back CoD4 did about the same thing over the course of its campaign and is still lauded as perhaps the last 'good' call of duty.

The game plays well, for a 5 dollar game on steam you could definitely get much worse, less polished, and typically perpetually stuck in 'early access' game. Compared to those IS defense is a godsend.

Its a waved based survival "rail shooter" stressing the rail of course as you never actually move from your spot however you do pivot in a full 360 degree area most of the action dealing with the front line and usually needing the pivot for flanks within the game to deal with enemies behind you. I havent yet gotten too far in but while you'll tend to die pretty quickly the game is clearly about getting your skill trees upgraded in order to progress further. 

The visuals considering what the game is and how much its costs are incredibly obviously not The BEST™ but are pretty goddamn good something that combined with the gameplay within leaves me hoping they manage in some VR integration in the future or a VR rerelease perhaps if I indulge in the VR wave in the future I'd pick this is up again in a heart beat.

All in all you get a really good Game for Buck ratio you get three stages to progress through and built in Mod support so if the modding scene takes off even a little bit the game will likely have more replayability then it has any reasonable right to have as a $8 game.

22521607.review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NJ03EudTMQw

IS Defense is a modern take on the old Beach Head games that were popular in arcades all around the world.  The premise is simple:  Man an MG nest and destroy everything that comes your way.  You have two weapons at your disposal--an MG and a rocket launcher--and numerous support abilities, ranging from supply drops to air strikes, that you can activate once you've attained enough kills.

Although the gameplay is rather simplistic, it's also highly replayable.  There are several "hooks" to keep you coming back like persistent skill trees, unlockable levels, leaderboards, and end-level statistics that show how many enemies you've killed, vehicles you've destroyed, and whether or not you survived longer than your previous best time.

Graphically, IS Defense is pretty impressive.  Thanks to epic explosions and ragdoll physics, blowing up incoming landing craft and technical trucks never gets old.  There are also lots of graphics options to tweak, including a much-needed FOV slider.  Best of all, the game performs quite well on my rig even in the later stages of invasions in which all hell is breaking loose (i7 4700, 8 GB RAM, GTX 970).

Overall, if you're looking for a simple, yet fun shooter chock full of explosions and carnage, IS Defense is a no-brainer for 8 bucks.  If you enjoyed the Beach Head games, I'd go as far as to say it's a must-buy.

39414451.review: The game revives the old arcade genre of Beach Head defender with its difficulty and ease of use. The enegies gradually increase in strength in the first mission until exponentially in the second, where the infantry swarms you without any chance of a break. The game is limited to only four missions, but locks everything until you achieve the certain amount of kills to unlock the next location. I've dumped four hours into this game without even trying and enjoyed every minute of it. Allied AI are rather compitant by moving into different positions, though fail in moving out of the way from oncoming vehicles or standing beside burning trucks. However the infantry AI make up for this by being EXTREMELY aggressive with pinpoint accuracy against enemy infantry, leaving you to deal with harder targets. Audio is clear though the music is difficult to hear over the multiple layers of combat audio, which is fine anyways cause you can blast whatever 5FDP song you want to this and it'll work. For the price of $5 I highly recommend this, and would gladly pay $10 for extra maps and what not.

39373828.review:
IS Defense is a fun little game. You sit in your little tower and shoot some terrorists, that want you (and pretty much the entirety of Europe) dead.
You start without any upgrades in the first level. Relatively quickly, you will aquire skill-points, with which you can add some very handy and fun upgrades to your tower and support-units, such as getting rid of magazines and therefore being able to shoot even more mindlessly into the crowd.
The support units are useful as well. I myself actually like the cheapest ones the best, the infantry and the supply plane. Both are really easy to get and help a lot. (You have a small bar on the left, which rises the more terrorists you shoot. If it's at stage one, you can use the first option and it will take away one part of the bar.)
There is not a lot of variation with the enemies you face. In the later levels, a few new ones will appear, but nothing too crazy, which isn't that bad, if you look at the kind of game you're playing.
Throughout the game, you will play on four different maps, which are in fact really different from each other, they're not just painted differntly, which is another plus point.

This game is pretty fun, if you want to play something simplistic just for inbetween. I would suggest buying it, when it's on sale and has a 50% discount, if are stingy, just like me.

Annoying things: The terrorists that run in your face, when you're not looking and then procede to explode in your face, which can end your game pretty quick, especially if there's three of them in a row so that you can't see anything for 5 seconds (if you survive their attack). Also, sometimes boxes, which the support plane drops, just fall through the floor. That can cost you your life too (though i witnessed this only on the third (Croatia) map).

Have fun playing!

Si con Hatred, los desarrolladores de Destructive Creations, no iban a agachar la cabeza ante su controversia generada, que ahora nos traen mas polemica. Pero en un buen Videojuego. 
 Pues, a comparacion de su antecesor. Éste mejora unas cuantas cosas, ya sea el rendimiento, mejores escenarios o un concepto diferente, como una buena jugabilidad.
 No tiene mucho que ver un Shooter Arcade Isometrico, con un Rail Shooter. Pero si, su motor grafico que ambos comparten, y lo mejorado de su gameplay. 
 Me explico, antes en Hatred, era dificil apuntar y los Hitboxes enemigos, estaban mal hechos. La camara no ayudaba en nada y los colores Monocromaticos confundian y camuflaban a todos con el escenario. 
 Pero en IS Defense, no solo mejoraron eso, si no que dispararle a los enemigos en primera persona, es mas efectivo y se puede disfrutar de los desmembramientos en primera fila. 
Los colores de los escenarios son mas distintivos, conservan una tonalidad oscura y con toques de colores terciarios, como en Hatred, pero no abusan del blanco y negro, y estan bien balanceados. Haciendo que ahora, se pueda diferenciar a un enemigo, de una pared.
 Aqui apenas se nos trae una historia, pero se nota que es sensilla, para un arcade simple.
 Lo tipico: ¨Isis Invade Europa. Fabrican una torreta automatica para hacerlos valer madres. Eres esa torreta y la salvacion para la humanidad.¨

39702613.review:
This goes to show that the Devs clearly where attention seeking after Hatred was released. However, I will admit this time, they made a simple but fun game. IS Defense is basically a graphically advanced Defense game you mostly find on flash game sites like Storm the Castle when it comes to premise and gameplay. The real difference here is that is has a skin of "stick it to the kebab" attitude, which we can all come to agree on. I guess it's a cheap "get out of the shit" card after what they pulled with Hatred, but there is something this has that Hatred doesn't. 

Fun. 

Weapons have a nice punch, especially when upgraded, the stages are endless defense missions but never feel dull or boring as you mow down the Islamic State's grunts, amour and suicide bomber sappers and rank up your abilites. Sure it's simple but it keept me playing to see the next levels. You feel like your a field commander and a MG nest gunner at the same time by managing troop support, supply drops and air support, plus, they finally use Napalm again, the smell of victory brings a tear to my eye. It's arcade fun with Michale Bay explosions, true, but it's just pure barebones fun and where we can all come together to Remove Kebab. 

Hatred was basically a crappy take on Postal and as a game on it's own failed to keep engament and any sense of value in gameplay or "story". IS Defence however, it's over the top and made like an attempt to stick it to political correctness, but as a person who just wants fun and a cheap thrill, it's a good one to fish out when on sale. 

Now let's see if Ancestors can make or break these guys now.
